## Introduction
Stovetop Tomato Basil Soup is a classic and comforting dish that is loved by many. It is a simple and flavorful soup made with fresh tomatoes, aromatic basil, and other ingredients that come together to create a delicious and satisfying meal. This soup is perfect for any time of the year and can be enjoyed on its own or paired with a grilled cheese sandwich for a complete meal.

## Ingredients
- 2 pounds fresh tomatoes, chopped
- 1 onion, diced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves, chopped
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 4 cups vegetable broth
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- Salt and pepper to taste

## Equipment
- Large pot
- Blender or immersion blender
- Cutting board
- Knife
- Wooden spoon

## Preparation Time
- 15 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 30 minutes

## Steps
1. Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Add the diced onion and minced garlic to the pot and saut√© until the onion is translucent and fragrant.
3. Add the chopped tomatoes to the pot and cook for about 5 minutes, until they start to soften.
4. Pour in the vegetable broth and add the chopped basil leaves.
5. Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. Remove the pot from the heat and let the soup cool slightly.
7. Using a blender or immersion blender, carefully puree the soup until smooth.
8. Return the soup to the pot and season with salt, pepper, and sugar to taste.
9. Heat the soup over low heat for a few minutes to warm it back up before serving.

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Stovetop Tomato Basil Soup hot with a sprinkle of freshly chopped basil on top.
- Pair it with a grilled cheese sandwich for a classic and comforting meal.
- Serve it alongside a fresh salad for a light and refreshing lunch.

## Variations
- Add a touch of cream or coconut milk for a creamy tomato basil soup.
- Roast the tomatoes in the oven before adding them to the soup for a deeper flavor.
- Add some cooked pasta or rice to make it a heartier meal.

## Tips and Tricks
- Use ripe tomatoes for the best flavor. If fresh tomatoes are not in season, you can also use canned tomatoes.
- Adjust the amount of basil according to your preference. You can add more if you love the taste of basil or reduce it if you prefer a milder flavor.
- If you like a chunkier soup, you can blend only a portion of the soup and leave some of the tomatoes and onions intact.

## Nutritional Information
- The nutritional information for Stovetop Tomato Basil Soup may vary depending on the specific ingredients used. However, in general, it is a low-calorie and nutritious dish. It is a good source of vitamins A and C, as well as antioxidants from the tomatoes and basil.

## Storage and Leftovers
- Stovetop Tomato Basil Soup can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 4 days. Reheat it on the stovetop or in the microwave before serving.

## Frequently Asked Questions
1. Can I use canned tomatoes instead of fresh tomatoes?
   - Yes, you can use canned tomatoes if fresh tomatoes are not available. Use about 2 cans (14 ounces each) of diced tomatoes.

2. Can I freeze the Stovetop Tomato Basil Soup?
   - Yes, you can freeze the soup for up to 3 months. Let it cool completely, then transfer it to freezer-safe containers or bags. Thaw it in the refrigerator overnight before reheating.

3. Can I use dried basil instead of fresh basil?
   - Fresh basil adds a vibrant flavor to the soup, but if you don't have it on hand, you can use dried basil. Use about 1 tablespoon of dried basil instead of the fresh basil leaves.

4. Can I make this soup in advance?
   - Yes, you can make the soup in advance and store it in the refrigerator. Reheat it on the stovetop before serving. The flavors may develop even more after sitting for a day or two.
